Common.Highlight.Common.Text: ± 264.08 acres
Residential-30 (Wake County ETJ); Single family residential developments on lot sizes of 30,000 sq. ft. or greater
Wake County Special Study Area & Residential (Town of Rolesville’s Urban Service Area)

Any development will most likely need to be serviced by private well and septic systems. Municipal water and sewer could potentially be available subject to utility extensions and annexation by the Town of Rolesville

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Located less than than 6 miles to eight different schools including four elementary schools, two middle schools, one high school and Wake Tech Community College, the site is a prime location for families looking to purchase a home in the Triangle Region. Convenient access onto I-540 and US Highway 401 provides an easy commute for workers throughout the Raleigh-Durham area.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: 264-Acre Investment or Development Opportunity for Sale

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: 9.95 acres (approximately 5 usable acres)
Zoned Residential Mixed-Use (RMX), Research & Development (RD) and Light Industrial (LI)
Permitted uses include hotel, office, service business, high-density residential, single family residential, repair shops, day care, community center, veterinary hospital, light manufacturing, etc.
Municipal water and sewer service available

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: Zoned Residential Mixed Use Conditional Use
Zoned Residential Mixed Use Conditional Use & Open Space
Zoned Residential Mixed Use Conditional Use & Highway Business Conditional Use

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Zoned Residential Mixed Use Conditional Use (CU RMX), Highway Business Conditional Use (CU HB) & Open Space (OS)
Municipal water and sewer service available

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Lots are located between Holding Village, a 256-acre planned mixed-use development including 305 townhomes/duplexes/work-play units, 583 apartments, 462 single family homes, 25,000 square feet of civic/institutional space, 48,000 square feet of retail space and 40,000 square feet of office space and Heritage, a 37-neighborhood development including 2,428 single family homes, a golf course, tennis courts, two swimming complexes, walking and biking trails, soccer fields, playgrounds, a fishing pond and an amphitheatre.

Common.Brochures.Common.BrochureName: Ligon Mill Road & Brimfield Springs Lane.pdf

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: ± 3.05 acres
Zoned Neighborhood Business Conditional Use (CU NB)
Permitted uses include office, professional services, restaurants, day care, some retail sales, indoor/outdoor recreation, hotel, light manufacturing, etc.
Future land use calls for Highway Corridor
Water and sewer available to serve the property
Site is fully entitled to develop a 23,236 sq. ft. single story office/flex building with 82 parking spaces

Ligon Mill Road is planned to be extended from Reynolds Mill Road to the NC Highway 98 Bypass; once completed, the property will have convenient access to Grove 98, the Wegman’s anchored mixed use project being developed by Stiles

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Property is conveniently located 0.5 miles from US Highway 1/Capital Boulevard, 1.5 miles from NC Highway 98 Bypass, 5.0 miles from US Highway 401 and 6.2 miles from I-540

Common.Photos.Common.ImageCaption: Ligon Mill Road & Brimfield Springs Lane.jpg

Dynamic.PrimaryImage.Common.ImageCaption: Ligon Mill Road & Brimfield Springs Lane.jpg

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: ± 3.87 to 20.15 acres
Zoned Highway Business Conditional Use (CU HB) (Wake Forest ETJ)

Permitted uses include live-work units, hotel/motel, office, personal and professional services, indoor/ outdoor amusement center, general commercial uses, restaurants, indoor/outdoor theater, recreational facilities, religious institutions, day cares, hospital, studios, automotive sales and services, self storage, etc.

The property is located in the US 1 Corridor Plan Overlay and is a part of the US 1 Corridor Study planned to transform Capital Boulevard into a superhighway by eliminating the existing stoplights and adding service roads that will run parallel to the highway. Capital Boulevard is planned to shift slightly east at the Burlington Mills Road/Capital Boulevard interchange, providing prime highway frontage for the site
City of Raleigh water and sewer available

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located along Burlington Mills Road, just off US Highway 1/Capital Boulevard, at one of two entrances to Shearon Farms Master Planned Community. Surrounded by an abundance of existing and planned residential developments including Kitchin Farms (263 homes), Porto Fino (121 homes) and Reynolds Mills (191 homes), as well as Neuse Industrial Park, the property offers a prime opportunity to serve as a regional retail center or office development
